text: it all began in March 2011
it started with peaceful protests but
the Syrian uprising turned into an armed
conflict after a deadly crackdown by
security troops a group of military
defectors then formed the Free Syrian
Army the aim to topple the government of
President Bashar al-assad today the Free
Syrian Army is the main western-backed
rebel force but there are many other
rebel factions some are jihadist groups
affiliated to al-qaeda the conflict has
reached a stalemate
with neither side able to achieve a
decisive victory and this online videos
have documented the battles and whorls
unfolding day by day with over 100,000
dead millions displaced and many lives
ruined this is the bloodiest chapter of
the Arab Spring the conflict is
inflicting economic stresses and
political uncertainties on the country's
neighbors Lebanon Jordan Turkey Iraq and
Egypt are struggling to accommodate the
tide of men women and children crossing
the borders more than two million people
have fled the war-torn country so far
Syria has become a proxy war drawing in
local regional and global actors Russia
and Iran are staunchly backing Bashar
al-assad the u.s. other Western powers
and several Arab Gulf countries are
behind the rebels
no one is expecting quick progress to
peace the path remains long and
complicated
